§ 30906. Restrictions(a) Profit.—The corporation may not operate for pecuniary profit to its members.
(b) Stocks and Dividends.—The corporation may not issue stock or declare or pay a dividend.
(Pub. L. 105–225, Aug. 12, 1998, 112 Stat. 1326.)

(b) The corporation may not issue stock or declare or pay a dividend.
